task_summary: A robot arm perceives, grasps, and places a pot from the countertop into the sink.

task_long_description.overview: This episode features a robot arm in a kitchen scene. The main objects involved are a blue pot on a countertop and a metallic sink. The robot must perceive, approach, grasp the pot, then transfer and place it purposefully in the sink, finishing with a retreat. The tree ensures visibility and successful grasping and places the pot gently on the sink surface. All steps are visible in sequential frames, indicating successful object manipulation under realistic workspace constraints.
preconditions: Pot located on the countertop and is visible.
Robot arm is operational, with an open gripper.
stepwise_plan: Perceive the pot and reacquire if not visible.
Open the gripper and position above the pot.
Compute grasp pose and approach precisely.
Execute top grasp and secure the pot.
Verify pot is in the gripper.
Move above the sink and place the pot on its surface.
Open the gripper to release the pot.
success_criteria: Pot ends up placed inside the sink.
Grasp is stable and release is verified.
failure_and_recovery: If pot not detected, re-scan raster pattern up to three times.
If grasp fails or pot slips, repeat perception and grasp sequence.
If sink is not detected, retry sink detection.
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates after pot is released in the sink and robot retreats.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: place the pot in the sink

node_specs.description: Checks if pot is visible to sensors.
Scans workspace for pot with raster pattern if initial visibility fails.
Detects precise location and pose of pot.
Opens gripper to specified width for grasping the pot.
Moves gripper above pot with a safe offset.
Computes top grasp pose for the pot.
Checks if pot is held in gripper.
Checks if sink is visible to sensors.
Moves pot above sink for placement.
Places pot on sink's surface with light force.
Opens gripper wide to release pot.
Moves gripper away from sink after placement.

failure_modes: Pot not visible due to occlusion or lighting.
Pot slips or falls during grasp or placement.
Sink detection fails due to clutter or occlusion.
recovery_strategy: Retry scanning and detection of pot and sink.
Repeat grasp sequence if pot is not held stably.
Abort and log if placement cannot be confirmed after retries.
assumptions: Frames suggest the pot is a small blue bowl, and the sink is metallic; this is strictly inferred from the images.
Instruction matches the visible objects and goal; no apparent conflict.
All pose/action names and targets are grounded in visual evidence.
No explicit instruction for multiple attempts or time limits, so defaults are used.

expected_success_criteria: Pot ends with visual confirmation in sink in final frame.
Robot does not drop pot outside sink.
Gripper is open and not interfering post-place.
